page.title: 06CALAN HEN IN LLANDYSUL
page.content: {"OLD" NEW YEAR IN LLANDYSUL.} This custom is unique to Llandysul Church and dates from 1752 when the introduction of the Gregorian Calander "lost" days. The Old New Year's Day was celebrated on January 12th when a breakfast feast was given by the local farmers for the people who had helped during the harvest. Then a game{ {"cnapan"(Black Ball)}was played. The people of{Llandysul}parish played against{Llanwennog}parish, and the goals were doors of churches at least 7 miles apart. It was unruly,involved any amount of players and lasted hours. A more formal celebration replaced this in 1833. Now the day starts with morning service attended by members of 11 neighbouring Sunday Schools. Each group recites from the Bible, sings and is catechized. The event is popular and well attended.
